Franklin Pierce was the 14th President of the United States, as well as the 7th Vice President of the United States. He was also a general in the U.S. Army and the Democratic Party's presidential nominee in 1852. Pierce was born in Hillsborough, New Hampshire, in 1804 and graduated from Dartmouth College in 1823.
